TextView.android:text: Names of Keyboard Buttons
When using the keyboard, you use different buttons on the keyboard. These buttons have some names according to their usage. The names of the keys on the keyboard are as follows.
Typewriter Keys:-
Typewriter keys on the keyboard are used to type information. These keys contain letters A to Z, numbers 0 to 9 and different symbols.
Toggle Keys:-
Caps lock, num lock, and scroll lock keys are called toggle keys. The on-off function is used in these keys. That is, when using these keys, the light on the keyboard is on-off.
Function Keys:-
The buttons F1 to F12 on the keyboard are called function keys. Function keys are used for shortcut work in the computer.
Navigation Keys:-
Navigation keys are used to navigate page up and down in a file. Or to change the position of the cursor on the page.
Numeric Keys:-
Numeric keys are used to make use of numbers when typing.
Combination Keys:-
Sometimes you have to use more than one button while working on your computer. Combination keys come together and interact with other buttons. This includes controls, alt, shift, delete buttons.
Special Purpose Keys:-
Special Purpose keys are used for special work in computers.
Home Keys :- The home key is used to move the cursor to the beginning of the line while typing into a file.
End Keys :- The end key is used to move the cursor to the end of the line while typing into a file.
Page-up Keys :- The Page-Up Key is used to move the cursor to the top of the page.
Page-down Keys :- The Page-down Key is used to move the cursor to the bottom of the page.

Print-Screen Keys :- The print screen key is used to capture the computer screen. While working on the computer, we can capture any information through a print-screen button and paste it into paint, word, etc.
